file_content.text: Your reputation is well-deserved. Thanks to you, the Republic's access to power has been seriously limited.
Brilliant! With those generators offline and the Republic hungering for a power source, the advantage is ours.
Let's hope those fools will be quavering in the dark for a good long while.
Their weakness is my pleasure.
Indeed. I am in your debt. And rest assured, I will spread word of your strength.
This success should put you in Darth Gravus's good graces.
Your master will be pleased.
I expect he will be quite satisfied. I am in your debt, and I will gladly spread word of your power.
Nothing to it.
Ah, modesty would feel misplaced. But I am in your debt, and I will gladly spread word of your power.
I'm also pleased you found evidence of my squad's demise. Perhaps now Gravus will grant me more veteran troopers.
It's unfortunate you found no evidence of my squad's demise. But with Gravus appeased, perhaps I can coax more veteran troopers from him.
The longer the Republic draws power from those generators, the more secure their foothold becomes.
I can't brief Lord Gravus now. I need time. Delay him.
My lord... how? He won't be pleased...
Use that undersized brain of yours to think of something, or I'll have it out of its little shell. Dismissed!
My apologies. Such esteemed company is a welcome change from the fools I deal with. And timely, if you would help with my... problem.
Hunter, your reputation precedes you and is a welcome change from the ineptitude here. Your help could make a difference with my... problem.
I've heard of you, agent. Such professional talent could make a difference with my... problem.
Forgive me. One wishes for competence, but wishes often go unfulfilled. Perhaps you could help me with a... problem.
Only the weak tolerate fools. Tell me your problem and I will consider it.
You'll have to convince me.
The trials of being a Sith--all are fools by comparison. Tell me your problem.
You'll have to convince me.
Whatever has you so worked up sounds... expensive. Gut feeling.
My help isn't cheap.
The Empire pays its debts, have no fear.
It depends on why you're dodging a briefing with your lord.
Maybe, but I have concerns.
I think you'll find our desires share common ground.
Threatening your men--while amusing--is not the best way to inspire loyalty.
Quite a temper you've got.
I need results more than loyalty.
My schedule's full.
I understand, but our desires share common ground.
We've learned the Republic has secured sections of the lower city hydro plant to serve their power needs.
Lord Gravus ordered me to destroy their generators, but the squad I sent went missing before they even reached the objective. Useless.
Meanwhile, the Republic reinforced its position. My men are simply outmatched.
Why is the hydro plant such a priority?
So why not strike elsewhere?
I can't imagine Lord Gravus will let such failure pass unanswered.
Your master won't be pleased.
True enough. Another failure and he will revoke my command. Fortunately, you and I have converging interests.
Your problem, not mine.
If the Republic strengthens its foothold on Taris, it's a problem for us all.
Lord Gravus believes cutting off the Republic's power will cripple their operations enough to shift the balance of power on the planet.
With your strength, you could disable those generators and strike a decisive blow against the enemy. And I would keep my lord happy. Agreed?
I will crush these Republic fools and leave them in darkness.
They will suffer greatly.
We will leave them trembling in darkness.
They will suffer greatly.
If you can pay, I'll play.
Sure, why not?
I've always had a soft spot in my heart for sabotage.
Count me in.
Excellent! Go to the hydro plant. Identify the functional generators and rig them to overload. Watch the Republic wage a war with no power!
Saving you from your master's wrath will put you in my debt.
Fine, but you will owe me.
Very well. Go to the hydro plant. Find the functional generators and rig them to overload. I will, as you say, be in your debt.
I couldn't care less about your command, but I'm happy to hit the Republic where it hurts.
I'll do it for my own reasons.
I suppose that will do. Go to the hydro plant. Find the generators that are still functional and rig them to overload.
And one final request about the squad that went missing today....
If you find any evidence explaining their disappearance, I would be pleased to see it.
I can't. [Refuse quest]
That is unfortunate. Come see me if you reconsider your priorities.
Leave me. I have command duties to attend to.
